The six greatest novels of Anatole France ...
decorations by Frank C. Papé, John Austen, Donia Nachshen.

Penguin island, translated by A. W. Evans.--The crime of Sylvestre Bonnard, translated by Lafcadio Hearn.--The revolt of the angels, translated by Mrs. Wilfrid Jackson.--The gods are athirst, translated by Alfred Allinson.--Thaïs, translated by Robert B. Douglas.--The red lily, translated by Winifred Stephens.
The three greatest novels of Anatole France ...
decorations by Frank C. Papé, Donia Nachshen.
4 p. l., 3-505 p. incl. front., illus.
Penguin island, translated by A.W. Evans.--The crime of Sylvestre Bonnard, translated by Lafcadio Hearn.--The revolt of the angels, translated by Mrs. Wilfrid Jackson.

Three-quarter red morocco with plain cloth sides. Gilt rule. Raised spine band with fleur de lis floral ornamentation in compartments. Author, volume title, and edition name in gilt. Plain endpapers. Top edge gilt. Partially unopened, untrimmed.

1. The crime of Sylvestre Bonnard.--2. Thaïs. Crainquebille, and other stories.--3. At the sign of the Reine Pédauque.--4. The opinions of Jerome Coignard. The garden of Epicurus.--5. The red lily.--6. A mummer's tale. The elm-tree on the mall.--7. The wicker-work woman.--8. The amethyst ring.--9. Monsieur Bergeret in Paris.--10. The aspirations of Jean Servien. Balthasar.--11. The bride of Corinth, and other poems & plays.--12. Mother of pearl.--13. The well of Saint Clare.--14. The white stone. The seven wives of Bluebeard.--15. Penguin Island.--16. The revolt of the angels.--17. The merrie tales of Jacques Tournebroche. Jocasta & the famished cat.--18. The gods are athirst.--19. Clio.--20. The Latin genius.--21-22. The life of Joan of Arc.--23. Little Pierre.--24. The bloom of life.--25. My friend's book.--26. Pierre Nozière.--27-30. On life & letters.

The learned societies and printing clubs of the United Kingdom: being an account of their respective origin, history, objects, and constitution: with full details respecting membership, fees,
their published works and transactions, notices of their periods and places of meeting, &c. and a general introduction and a classified index.

a short and succinct history of the principal birds noticed by Pliny and Aristotle first published by Doctor William Turner, 1544.
Ed. with introduction, translation, notes, and appendix, by A. H. Evans.

With reproduction of original t.-p.: Avivm praecipvarvm, qvarvm apvd Plinivm et Aristotelem mentio est, breuis & succincta historia. Ex optimis quibusque scriptoribus contexta, scholio illustrata & aucta. Adiectis nominibus Graecis, Germanicis & Britanicis. Per Dn. Guilielmum Turnerum, artium & medicinae doctorem. Coloniae excudebat Ioan. Gymnicus, Anno M.D.XLIII.
Original and translation on opposite pages.

Longfellow and Lieut. A. W. Evans, U.S.A. Assists. Topography by W. H. Dennis and C. Fendall, Sub-Assists. Hydrography by the parties under the direction of C. O. Boutelle, W. S. Edwards, Assists. and C. Fendall, Sub-Assist.
From its Report of the Superintendent of the Coast Survey, showing the progess of the survey during the year 1864 (Washington, Government Printing Office, 1866). Map 27.
"No. 27" is in the upper left corner.
Available also through the Library of Congress web site as raster image.

Evans, U.S.A. Assistants. Topography by A. M. Harrison, Assistant. Hydrography by the party under the command of Lieut. S. D. Trenchard, U.S.N. Assist. 1857. Resurvey of bar by C. O. Boutelle, Asst. in 1862. Redd. drng. by P. Witzel. Engd. by A. Maedel and R. F. Bartle. Bowen & Co. lith., Philada.
